main.java.entity

Class CircuitManagement

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • main.java.entity.CircuitManagement

  • public class CircuitManagement
extends java.util.Observable
    The Class CircuitManagement is used as an entry point into the model for the controller. It manages all the model (load the map, load the delivery list create the circuits)

      void calculateCircuits(int nbDeliveryman, boolean continueInterruptedCalculation)

      Calculates the distances between all barycenter and the center of all deliveries in order to return the most distant cluster.

      • cluster

        public java.util.List<java.util.ArrayList<Delivery>> cluster()
                                                      throws main.java.exception.NoRepositoryException
        Clustering algorithm, performing K-means clustering algorithm and if the clusters are unbalanced in terms of cardinality, balance those clusters.
        Returns:
        a list containing all clusters
        Throws:
        main.java.exception.NoRepositoryException - when no repository is found in the delivery list

      • KmeansClustering

        public javafx.util.Pair<java.util.List<java.util.ArrayList<Delivery>>,java.util.List<javafx.util.Pair<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double>>> KmeansClustering(int numberOfClusters,
                                                                                                                                                            java.util.List<Delivery> deliveriesToCluster)
        K-means clustering algorithm.
        Parameters:
        numberOfClusters - the expected number of clusters
        deliveriesToCluster - all deliveries to partition in clusters
        Returns:
        a pair containing the clusters and their respective barycenters.

      • KmeansClusteringStep

        public java.util.List<java.util.ArrayList<Delivery>> KmeansClusteringStep(java.util.List<javafx.util.Pair<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double>> barycenters,
                                                                          java.util.List<Delivery> deliveriesToCluster)
        Associates all deliveries to their closest barycenter and updates all barycenters. Each set of association to a barycenter results in a new cluster.
        Parameters:
        barycenters - the barycenters of the distribution
        deliveriesToCluster - all deliveries to partition in clusters
        Returns:
        the list containing all clusters

        Calculate new barycenters based on a distribution of deliveries in clusters.
        Parameters:
        currentDistribution - the current clustered distribution
        Returns:
        a list containing all barycenters

      • addRandomBarycenter

        public void addRandomBarycenter(java.util.List<javafx.util.Pair<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double>> barycenters,
                                java.util.List<Delivery> deliveries)
        Adds a random barycenter.
        Parameters:
        barycenters - the list containing all barycenters
        deliveries - the list containing all deliveries

      • evaluateCluster

        protected boolean evaluateCluster(java.util.List<java.util.ArrayList<Delivery>> newDistribution,
                                  java.util.List<java.util.ArrayList<Delivery>> oldDistribution)
        Evaluate a clustered distribution validity. Checks if old and new distribution are different (return false if so).
        Parameters:
        newDistribution - the new clustered distribution
        oldDistribution - the old clustered distribution
        Returns:
        true, if both distribution are equal

      • balanceDistribution

        protected javafx.util.Pair<java.util.List<java.util.ArrayList<Delivery>>,java.util.List<javafx.util.Pair<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double>>> balanceDistribution(javafx.util.Pair<java.util.List<java.util.ArrayList<Delivery>>,java.util.List<javafx.util.Pair<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double>>> distributionToBalance)
        Balance the clustered distribution. Takes the most distant cluster and adds/remove deliveries until its cardinality is valid. Then performs Kmeans algorithm on the rest of the deliveries. Repeats those two steps until the distribution is full.
        Parameters:
        distributionToBalance - the distribution to balance, which contains all the clusters and their respective barycenters
        Returns:
        the balanced clusters and their barycenters

      • balanceMostDistantCluster

        protected javafx.util.Pair<java.util.ArrayList<Delivery>,java.util.List<Delivery>> balanceMostDistantCluster(java.util.List<java.util.ArrayList<Delivery>> distributionToBalance,
                                                                                                             java.util.List<javafx.util.Pair<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double>> barycenters)
        Return the most distant cluster from the center of all deliveries.
        Parameters:
        distributionToBalance - the current distribution of clusters
        barycenters - the barycenters of the current distribution
        Returns:
        a pair containing the most distant cluster and the rest of the deliveries

      • calculateGlobalAndMostDistantBarycenter

        protected javafx.util.Pair<javafx.util.Pair<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double>,javafx.util.Pair<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double>> calculateGlobalAndMostDistantBarycenter(java.util.List<java.util.ArrayList<Delivery>> distribution,
                                                                                                                                                                            java.util.List<javafx.util.Pair<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double>> barycenters)
        Calculates the distances between all barycenter and the center of all deliveries in order to return the most distant cluster.
        Returns:
        the most distant barycenter and the center of all deliveries

      • addDeliveryToCluster

        protected void addDeliveryToCluster(java.util.List<Delivery> cluster,
                                    javafx.util.Pair<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double> barycenters,
                                    java.util.List<Delivery> restOfDeliveries)
        Adds a delivery to the cluster. The delivery is selected according to its closeness to the cluster (actually to the barycenter)
        Parameters:
        cluster - the current cluster to balance
        barycenters - the all barycenters of the current distribution
        restOfDeliveries - the rest of deliveries

      • removeDeliveryFromCluster

        protected void removeDeliveryFromCluster(java.util.List<Delivery> cluster,
                                         javafx.util.Pair<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double> barycenter,
                                         java.util.List<Delivery> restOfDeliveries)
        Remove a delivery from the cluster. The delivery must be the closest to the center of all the deliveries.

      • checkClusterValidity

        protected boolean checkClusterValidity(java.util.List<java.util.ArrayList<Delivery>> clustersToCheck)
        Check if distribution has same-size clusters.
        Returns:
        the validity of all cluster's cardinality.

      • calculateCircuits

        public void calculateCircuits(int nbDeliveryman,
                              boolean continueInterruptedCalculation)
                       throws main.java.exception.MapNotChargedException,
                              main.java.exception.DijkstraException,
                              main.java.exception.NoRepositoryException,
                              main.java.exception.TSPLimitTimeReachedException,
                              main.java.exception.DeliveriesNotLoadedException
        generic method to call when calculation of the circuits is asked by HCI call the cluster method and create the circuits one by one after having calculated the atomic path between each delivery.
        Parameters:
        nbDeliveryman - the number delivery-men
        continueInterruptedCalculation - true if the method is called after having interrupted the calculation at least once
        Throws:
        main.java.exception.MapNotChargedException - when the map is not properly charged
        main.java.exception.DeliveriesNotLoadedException - when the delivery list is not properly charged
        main.java.exception.DijkstraException - when a problem happened during the dijkstra algorithm
        main.java.exception.NoRepositoryException - when no repository is found in the delivery list
        main.java.exception.TSPLimitTimeReachedException - when the limit time we set for the calculation is reached before the end of the calculation

      • checkNodeInDeliveryList

        public boolean checkNodeInDeliveryList(Node nodeTested)
        Check if a node is contained in the delivery list.
        Parameters:
        nodeTested - the node tested
        Returns:
        true, if successful

        Returns:

      • addDelivery

        public void addDelivery(Node nodeDelivery,
                        int duration,
                        Node previousNode)
        Adds the delivery after the delivery present at the selected node in the circuit that contains it. It does it by calling the generic add method specifying that we want to modify the delivery list
        Parameters:
        nodeDelivery - the node where the new delivery will be
        duration - the duration of the delivery
        previousNode - the previous node

      • addDelivery

        private void addDelivery(Node nodeDelivery,
                         int duration,
                         Node previousNode,
                         boolean changeDeliveryList)
        Generic method to add a delivery at the node selected after the previous node selected, precising if we want to change the delivery list or not by doing so.
        Parameters:
        nodeDelivery - the node delivery
        duration - the duration
        previousNode - the previous node
        changeDeliveryList - if we modify the delivery list by adding the delivery TODO check if correct because sounds weird

      • removeDelivery

        public void removeDelivery(Node nodeDelivery)
                    throws main.java.exception.ManagementException
        Removes the delivery at the node selected from the delivery list. It does it by calling the generic remove method specifying that we want to modify the delivery list
        Parameters:
        nodeDelivery - the node delivery
        Throws:
        main.java.exception.ManagementException - the management exception
